title: “Around the World” Travel Talk
setupSteps: Share one fun fact per destination.
Ask residents if they’ve been there or want to go.
Play a short music snippet related to destination.
Close with “where would you go today?”
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside “travel interview” with 3 destinations.
dementiaAdaptation: Keep to familiar places; accept imaginative answers.
lowVisionAdaptation: Spoken activity; describe images aloud.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute bedside travel chat.

title: “Finish the Lyrics”
setupSteps: Reveal and sing the chorus together.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside with 5 lyric prompts.
dementiaAdaptation: Use choruses only; accept humming as success.
lowVisionAdaptation: Audio-first, read prompts aloud.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 3 songs bedside, one prompt each.

title: “Guess That Sound”
supplies: Sound clips (phone/speaker) or real items (keys, paper, bell)
setupSteps: Play one sound at a time.
Reveal answer and share a quick fun fact.
checklistItems: Prepare sound list and test speaker
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside version with 5 sounds and simple choices.
dementiaAdaptation: Use very familiar sounds; accept any attempt; keep it playful.
lowVisionAdaptation: Perfect fit (audio-based).
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5 sounds + 5 quick guesses bedside.

title: “Hot Potato” Balloon Edition
setupSteps: Stop music; holder answers a fun question or does a gentle stretch.
bedBoundAdaptation: Staff brings balloon bedside when “stopped”; resident taps balloon back.
dementiaAdaptation: Simple prompts; avoid elimination; keep it silly and kind.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use bright balloon; announce direction and turns.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Bedside balloon pass with staff, 10 taps goal.

title: “Make a Playlist” Resident Picks
setupSteps: Ask each resident for 1–2 favorite songs/artists.
Build a shared playlist by theme.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside request interview + play their top 3.
dementiaAdaptation: Offer choices by decade; keep it simple.
lowVisionAdaptation: Spoken interview format.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute bedside “top 3 songs” session.

title: “Mystery Bag” Object Guess
setupSteps: Reveal and pass to next person.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring bag bedside; do 5 objects max.
dementiaAdaptation: Very familiar objects, gentle prompts, accept any attempt.
lowVisionAdaptation: Excellent tactile activity.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-object bedside mystery bag.

title: “Pass the Parcel” Prize Wrap Game
setupSteps: Pause music randomly; person holding unwraps one layer.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring parcel to bedside when music stops; staff assists passing.
dementiaAdaptation: Slower pace, fewer layers, gentle prompts.
lowVisionAdaptation: Verbal cues; tactile unwrapping is great.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-layer parcel bedside with mini prize.

title: “This or That” Rapid-Fire Choices
setupSteps: Explain: choose one option, no wrong answers.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside version with 10 prompts and optional follow-up.
dementiaAdaptation: Use simple, concrete prompts; no follow-up pressure.
lowVisionAdaptation: Spoken prompts only.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10 prompts bedside for quick engagement.

title: “Two Truths and a Tale” (Story Edition)
setupSteps: Explain: share 2 real facts and 1 silly made-up “tale.”
Group guesses which is the tale.
End with group laughs and applause.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside version: staff reads 3 statements and resident guesses.
dementiaAdaptation: Use staff-led stories; residents guess only.
lowVisionAdaptation: Spoken prompts only.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5 rounds bedside of “truth or tale” guessing.

title: “Who Am I?” Celebrity Guess Game
setupSteps: Place card on resident’s forehead (or hold up).
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside version with staff holding card; resident asks 5 questions max.
dementiaAdaptation: Use photos and very familiar names; offer multiple-choice hints.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read name aloud to group only; resident uses questions, not reading.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5 rounds bedside with easy names.

title: Adult Coloring & Calm Corner
setupSteps: Set up a clean table with art supplies.
checklistItems: Label and save artwork if resident wants
bedBoundAdaptation: Use a lap desk; offer thicker crayons/markers for easier grip; keep to 10–20 minutes.
dementiaAdaptation: Use simple pictures, fewer choices, demonstrate first strokes, encourage sensory enjoyment over “staying in lines.”
lowVisionAdaptation: Use bold-line pages and high-contrast markers; offer larger shapes and strong lighting.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “Color & Chat”: color one small section together while talking about a favorite memory.

title: Arts & Crafts: Seasonal Greeting Cards
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring a pre-folded card and stickers bedside; resident decorates while you assist with glue/placement.
dementiaAdaptation: Use sticker-based crafting, step-by-step one task at a time, praise effort and keep it simple.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use bold markers, large stickers, high-contrast paper, bright lighting.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Make a “mini card” with 3 stickers + one short message dictated by resident.

title: Balloon Tennis (Pool Noodle Rackets)
setupSteps: Create a seated “net” line across tables or floor.
checklistItems: Set up safe area and seating
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside balloon taps with pool noodle, 10-tap goal.
dementiaAdaptation: No scoring; just keep balloon moving.
lowVisionAdaptation: Bright balloon, verbal cues, closer positioning.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 3-minute bedside balloon tennis.

title: Balloon Volleyball
setupSteps: Create a soft “net” line with tape or a noodle.
Seat residents in two teams facing each other.
Explain: tap balloon over the line, keep it off the floor.
bedBoundAdaptation: Use a balloon “keep it up” challenge at bedside with staff tapping back.
dementiaAdaptation: Remove scoring, focus on “keep it moving,” simple cheer prompts.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use bright balloon colors, call out direction (“coming to you”), reduce speed with softer taps.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Bedside balloon toss for 3–5 minutes.

title: Bible Study
setupSteps: Choose passage and a simple theme (hope, peace, gratitude, forgiveness).
Print large-print handouts with 3–5 discussion prompts.
Open with a short welcome and optional prayer.
Discuss prompts; close with prayer or a hymn.
bedBoundAdaptation: Offer bedside reading and 1–2 short reflection questions; provide a printed verse card to keep.
dementiaAdaptation: Use short passages (a few verses), repeat key line, focus on one simple takeaway, incorporate familiar hymns.
lowVisionAdaptation: Large-print Bibles/handouts, read aloud, high-contrast print, allow audio Bible if available.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10-minute devotional bedside: read a verse, ask one gentle question, end with a brief prayer or calming affirmation.

title: Bible Study (Discussion + Prayer)
setupSteps: Choose a short passage and 2–3 discussion questions.
Set seating in a quiet area.
bedBoundAdaptation: Read a short passage at bedside and offer a brief prayer and conversation.
dementiaAdaptation: Use simple familiar verses, short readings, repetitive comforting themes, music hymn option.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read everything aloud; offer large-print Bibles; avoid relying on handouts.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “Verse of the Day”: 1 verse + 1 question + 1 prayer request.

title: Bingo
setupSteps: Choose bingo type (standard, picture, theme, holiday).
Set tables/chairs for clear sightlines and easy mobility access.
Pass out cards + chips/daubers (or pre-place at seats).
Explain rules (how to win, how to call “Bingo,” prize policy).
Start calling numbers with a steady pace and repeat each call twice.
checklistItems: Do a “practice call” for new players
Clean up supplies and reset room
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring a lap tray/overbed table, use a single large-print card, offer hand-over-hand or verbal cueing to mark spaces, shorten rounds.
dementiaAdaptation: Use Picture Bingo or 4-Corners Bingo, slower pace, fewer cards per person, frequent reassurance, celebrate near-wins to keep mood positive.
lowVisionAdaptation: Large-print/high-contrast cards, bright contrasting markers, call loudly and repeat, announce the full number (“B–12”), offer a magnifier or tactile chips.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Mini-bingo with 1 card bedside; staff calls 10–20 numbers only; use “first row” or “4 corners” to finish quickly.

title: Bingo Dauber Art
bedBoundAdaptation: Lap tray + taped paper; fewer colors to manage.
dementiaAdaptation: Simple templates, one color at a time, lots of praise.
lowVisionAdaptation: Bold templates, high-contrast paper, thick dot markers.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Complete one small template bedside.

title: Card Games
setupSteps: Choose game based on group: Go Fish, War, Crazy Eights, Uno-style, Rummy, Blackjack-lite.
Teach rules in 3 simple steps (goal, turn, win).
Deal cards; do a practice round.
Keep pace moving; offer reminders without over-correcting.
checklistItems: Track score only if it increases fun
bedBoundAdaptation: Use bedside card holder and overbed table; choose simple games (War/Go Fish) with fewer steps.
dementiaAdaptation: Use matching games (pairs), fewer cards, color-based cues, repeat rules frequently, team play with staff support.
lowVisionAdaptation: Large-print decks, high-contrast table surface, verbalize plays, allow resident to hold cards closer or use a magnifier.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5–10 minute “High Card” or “War” bedside; quick win conditions and lots of positive feedback.

title: Card Games Social (War, Uno, Kings in the Corner)
setupSteps: Choose a game that fits the group.
Set up table and deal practice hand.
Explain rules and keep them consistent.
checklistItems: Cue residents when it’s their turn
bedBoundAdaptation: Use card holders and play a simple 1:1 game (War or High-Low).
dementiaAdaptation: Use simple games with fewer rules (War, matching pairs); provide step-by-step prompts.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use large-print cards; read options aloud; reduce speed and clutter on table.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Play “High-Low”: resident guesses if next card is higher/lower; quick and engaging.

title: Chair Exercise Circle
setupSteps: Remind residents to move at their own pace.
checklistItems: Check for safe footwear and posture
bedBoundAdaptation: Do bed-level range of motion (arms, ankles) with gentle cueing and short duration.
dementiaAdaptation: Use mirroring, simple repeated movements, upbeat familiar music, minimal instructions.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use verbal step-by-step cues and consistent pacing; position resident close to leader.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute “movement snack”: 3 exercises + breathing to boost mood and circulation.

title: Chair Yoga / Stretch & Breathe
setupSteps: Seat residents with space between chairs.
Add breathing: inhale 3 counts, exhale 4 counts.
End with gentle applause and water reminder.
checklistItems: Set safe spacing and brakes on wheelchairs
bedBoundAdaptation: Do upper-body stretches in bed with pillow support; short sets (5–8 minutes).
dementiaAdaptation: Mirror movements, use simple one-step cues, repeat the same routine weekly for familiarity.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use verbal cues and tactile demonstration (with consent), describe motions clearly.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute bedside stretch + breathing reset.

title: Classic Bingo
supplies: Bingo cage or number caller app
setupSteps: Set tables/chairs with clear pathways for walkers/wheelchairs.
Place bingo cards and daubers at each seat.
Set up caller area with cage/app and visible call sheet.
Display prize options (if used) and explain rules.
checklistItems: Announce start time and invite residents
Call numbers clearly and repeat once
Assist residents who need help marking
Confirm winners and reset for next round
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring a small stack of cards and a dauber to bedside; call numbers 1:1 and assist with marking; shorten to 10–15 minutes.
dementiaAdaptation: Use fewer cards (1 per person), simpler patterns (straight line), slower pacing, frequent reminders, visual cue card for “BINGO.”
lowVisionAdaptation: Use large-print/tactile cards, high-contrast markers, call numbers louder and slower, let resident sit closer to caller.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Play “Mini Bingo” with a 3x3 grid and 15 numbers; quick win within 5–10 minutes.

title: Coffee & Current Events Chat
checklistItems: Welcome group and set respectful tone
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring 2–3 headlines bedside and ask simple opinion questions.
dementiaAdaptation: Use simpler topics (weather, local events, seasonal themes); keep discussions short with frequent recap.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read everything aloud; avoid small print reliance; minimize background noise.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “Headline & Memory”: one headline + one related personal story prompt.

title: Coffee Can Basketball
setupSteps: Place basket at safe distance (adjust by ability).
Give each resident 3–5 shots per turn.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside basket on chair; resident tosses foam ball into bin from bed.
dementiaAdaptation: No scoring, just “make one shot” goal, frequent praise.
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast basket rim, verbal distance cues, allow closer line.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10 tosses bedside with count-out-loud encouragement.

title: Coloring
setupSteps: Choose page styles (seasonal, nature, faith, mandalas, simple outlines).
Set up a “color bar” of supplies in the center of tables.
Offer choice of pages and tools.
Display finished pages on a board (optional).
checklistItems: Set out coloring pages and clipboards
Provide a variety of coloring tools
Invite sharing or display finished work
bedBoundAdaptation: Use lap tray, thicker markers, tape paper to tray to prevent sliding, shorter coloring sessions.
dementiaAdaptation: Use simple bold outlines, limited color choices (3–5), focus on process over outcome, offer gentle prompts (“Let’s color the flower”).
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast bold pages, thick markers, allow resident to choose colors by touch/placement; staff can outline with a darker border first.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: “Color a corner” goal; resident completes a small section; finish with a quick compliment and choice to continue later.

title: Comedy Hour (Clips & Laughs)
setupSteps: Pause for quick reactions and laughter breaks.
bedBoundAdaptation: In-room clip session with brief check-ins.
dementiaAdaptation: Short clips, avoid confusing plots, keep lights comfortable.
lowVisionAdaptation: Audio comedy works well; narrate visuals briefly.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10–15 minute bedside comedy clips + one reaction question.

title: Craft: Painting with Watercolors (Simple Wash)
setupSteps: Cover tables and set paint stations.
checklistItems: Explain goal: enjoy process, not perfection
bedBoundAdaptation: Use a lap desk and a small watercolor pad; do short sessions with minimal water to avoid spills.
dementiaAdaptation: Use paint-by-area prompts (“paint the sky”), limit colors, offer hand-over-hand cueing if appropriate.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use bold outlines on paper, high-contrast subjects, strong lighting, thicker brushes.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do a 10-minute “postcard painting”: one simple shape (sun + horizon) together.

title: Craft: Paper Chain Decorations
setupSteps: Residents create chains in chosen colors.
Combine into one long facility chain.
bedBoundAdaptation: Provide pre-cut strips; resident loops while staff staples/tapes.
dementiaAdaptation: Pre-cut strips, one-step loop action, lots of praise.
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast paper, tactile looping.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Make 5 loops bedside.

title: Craft: Tissue Paper Flowers
setupSteps: Demonstrate accordion fold and tie with pipe cleaner.
Make bouquet display for common area.
bedBoundAdaptation: Provide pre-folded stacks; resident fluffs petals bedside.
dementiaAdaptation: Use pre-made steps; resident completes final “fluff” and color choice.
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast tissue colors; tactile activity works well.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Finish one flower bedside.

title: Current Events Coffee Talk
setupSteps: Pick 3–5 neutral, non-upsetting topics (weather, local events, sports scores, community news).
Keep it respectful; redirect if heated.
bedBoundAdaptation: Read 2 headlines bedside and ask 1 opinion question each.
dementiaAdaptation: Keep topics familiar and simple; focus on conversation more than details.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read aloud; avoid small print reliance.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute bedside headline chat.

title: Deal or No Deal
setupSteps: Assign money amounts to envelopes (keep amounts fun and simple).
Choose one resident as main player; others as “case holders.”
Explain rounds: open cases, receive offer, choose Deal/No Deal.
Dramatically read banker offers; keep humor friendly.
Reveal final case and celebrate the moment.
checklistItems: Explain rounds and Deal/No Deal choice
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside resident can be the main player; staff brings envelopes to choose from; others participate from group room.
dementiaAdaptation: Use fewer cases (8–12), simpler amounts, guided choices (“Deal for a prize now?”), reduce suspense length.
lowVisionAdaptation: Large bold numbers on envelopes, read everything aloud, allow resident to choose by pointing/touching.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 6-envelope “micro” version bedside; 2 rounds max; immediate prize/reward at end.

title: Deal or No Deal (Group Edition)
setupSteps: Assign numbers and display them clearly.
Set up tracking board for amounts still in play.
Explain opening cases and banker offers.
checklistItems: Select a main player (rotate each round)
Open cases on schedule (e.g., 3 then 2 then 1)
Remove opened amounts from the board
Make banker offer and vote as a group (optional)
bedBoundAdaptation: Do a mini version with 6–8 envelopes at bedside; resident chooses numbers and you reveal amounts aloud.
dementiaAdaptation: Use fewer cases, simpler values (prizes instead of money), cooperative group voting, frequent reminders of the goal.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use large number labels and read all values aloud; have resident point/tap rather than read.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Use 5 envelopes: 1 small, 3 medium, 1 big prize; quick suspense in 5–10 minutes.

title: Dominoes
setupSteps: Choose style: Straight play, Draw Dominoes, or Matching Train.
Demonstrate matching ends with 3 sample moves.
End after 1–2 rounds or when energy drops.
checklistItems: Set out dominoes and clear table space
Offer turn reminders and gentle cues
bedBoundAdaptation: Use overbed table; staff “fans” dominoes for easy selection; resident points and staff places piece.
dementiaAdaptation: Use “match the picture/dots” only, fewer dominoes in hand, allow coaching, celebrate correct matches quickly.
lowVisionAdaptation: Large-dot or high-contrast dominoes, use tactile “raised dot” sets if available, staff announces dots aloud.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Matching Train bedside with 10–15 tiles total; quick success and short duration.

title: Dominoes (Classic or Mexican Train)
setupSteps: Choose game style based on group ability.
Set up table with clear space for tiles.
Explain rules briefly and do a practice turn.
checklistItems: Seat players with enough elbow room
Explain matching rules and turn order
Assist with tile reading when requested
End game respectfully and rotate partners
bedBoundAdaptation: Do a simplified matching game at bedside (match ends only) with 10–12 tiles.
dementiaAdaptation: Use matching-only rules, open-hand play (tiles face up), minimize scoring, lots of cueing.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use large-print/high-contrast dominoes; allow tactile identification; read tiles aloud as needed.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Play “Domino Match”: lay 5 tiles, ask resident to find the matching end; build a short chain.

title: Facility Scavenger Hunt (Photo/Item Based)
setupSteps: Use safe items: “find a clock,” “find a red object,” “find a leaf picture.”
Decide mobility level: seated hunt using photos or supervised hallway hunt.
bedBoundAdaptation: Use a photo scavenger hunt bedside (staff shows pictures; resident identifies).
dementiaAdaptation: Use 5–8 items max, simple categories, staff buddy support.
lowVisionAdaptation: Tactile or verbal clues; avoid tiny print; staff reads items aloud.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Bedside “I Spy” using room items.

title: Folding Party (Towels & Linens)
category: Life Skills | Fine Motor | Purposeful Activity
setupSteps: Residents fold at their own pace.
Deliver folded items per facility policy.
bedBoundAdaptation: Provide a small stack bedside; resident folds 3–5 items.
dementiaAdaptation: Use washcloths only, simple fold, repeat praise.
lowVisionAdaptation: Tactile activity; verbal instruction only.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Fold 5 washcloths bedside.

title: Garden Club (Indoor Pots)
setupSteps: Set table covers and potting stations.
Place pots in safe sunny area.
bedBoundAdaptation: Use a small tray pot bedside; staff assists scooping.
dementiaAdaptation: Simple steps, one herb type, repeat routine weekly.
lowVisionAdaptation: Tactile soil activity; staff helps labeling with bold print.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Plant one pot bedside, quick sensory engagement.

title: Gentle Competition: The Price Is Right (Seated Edition)
checklistItems: Show item and explain guessing rules
Collect guesses verbally or on board
bedBoundAdaptation: Show item pictures bedside and do 5 quick guesses with supportive cues.
dementiaAdaptation: Use either/or price choices, cooperative group guesses, focus on fun reactions not accuracy.
lowVisionAdaptation: Describe items clearly; avoid small printed labels; read options aloud.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “3 items challenge” at bedside with simple ranges and celebration.

title: Gentle Drum Circle (Rhythm Group)
setupSteps: End with a calm slow rhythm.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring shaker/drum bedside for short rhythm session.
dementiaAdaptation: Repetition and mirroring; short duration.
lowVisionAdaptation: Audio/tactile activity fits well.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 3 rhythms bedside for 5 minutes.

title: Guided Breathing & Mindfulness
setupSteps: Add body scan: shoulders, hands, jaw relax.
Return to normal lighting and orientation.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside breathing with short body scan.
dementiaAdaptation: Very short (3–5 minutes), simple cues, calming tone.
lowVisionAdaptation: Not vision-dependent.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 3-minute bedside breath reset.

title: Guided Painting (Watercolor or Simple Acrylic)
setupSteps: Choose one easy scene (sunset, flower, simple landscape).
Offer help with brush grip and paint amount.
Dry and label artwork for display.
checklistItems: Cover tables and set paint stations
bedBoundAdaptation: Use watercolor pencils + water brush on lap tray to reduce mess.
dementiaAdaptation: Use 2–3 colors max, simple shapes, short steps.
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast subject, thicker brush strokes, staff outlines shapes first.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Paint a single shape (sun/flower) bedside in 10 minutes.

title: Guided Relaxation (Breathing & Imagery)
setupSteps: Create a quiet space and reduce distractions.
Explain it’s optional to close eyes.
bedBoundAdaptation: Do bedside breathing with hand-on-belly cue (if appropriate) and a 2–3 minute calming script.
dementiaAdaptation: Keep it short (5–8 minutes), use simple repeated phrases, avoid complex imagery.
lowVisionAdaptation: Works well; rely on voice guidance and calm pacing.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “3-3-3”: three breaths, three shoulder rolls, three positive thoughts.

title: Guided Reminiscence (Theme Talk)
supplies: Theme cards (school days, first job, holidays)
setupSteps: Keep each share short to include everyone.
checklistItems: Validate and redirect gently if needed
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside talk with 2–3 questions and a photo prompt.
dementiaAdaptation: Use concrete prompts (photos, objects), short questions, avoid correcting details.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use tactile objects and spoken prompts.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10-minute “memory moment” with one object/photo.

title: Hand Massage & Relaxation
setupSteps: Warm hands with towel if available.
Use gentle circular motions 3–5 minutes per hand.
End with deep breaths and hydration reminder.
bedBoundAdaptation: Perfect bedside 1:1 with short duration.
dementiaAdaptation: Very calming; narrate steps; watch for sensitivity.
lowVisionAdaptation: Not vision-dependent.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute hand massage + 2 calming breaths.

title: Holiday/Seasonal Door Decorating
setupSteps: Prep pre-cut shapes for easy participation.
Staff assembles on doors per policy.
bedBoundAdaptation: Resident decorates one piece bedside that gets added to their door.
dementiaAdaptation: Simple tasks (color one shape), lots of praise, avoid overstimulation.
lowVisionAdaptation: Bold shapes, thick markers, tactile stickers.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Decorate one cutout bedside in 10 minutes.

title: Independent Activity: Magazine Collage Board
setupSteps: Set out magazines by interest (sports, travel, food).
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring pre-cut images bedside and let resident choose placement while you glue.
dementiaAdaptation: Limit choices, use simple categories, provide step-by-step prompts, focus on sensory selection.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use large images, high contrast, tactile labels; describe images aloud.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Make a “favorites page” with 6 images and brief conversation about each.

title: Karaoke / Sing-Along
setupSteps: Check mic volume and minimize feedback.
Offer solo or group chorus options.
bedBoundAdaptation: Do bedside sing-along with 2–3 songs; resident can hum or tap rhythm.
dementiaAdaptation: Use well-known choruses, repeat favorites, keep structure predictable, avoid overstimulation.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read lyrics aloud or rely on familiar songs; large-print lyric sheets if used.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “Duet Minute”: one verse together, then a short chat about the song.

title: Karaoke & Sing-Along
setupSteps: Invite residents to sing solo, duet, or group chorus.
Keep it supportive and fun (no pressure).
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside “favorite chorus” singing with lyric prompt and soft volume.
dementiaAdaptation: Use familiar choruses, repeat favorites, keep sessions short.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read lyrics aloud; prioritize audio participation.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 3-song bedside sing-along with one memory question per song.

title: Life Story Timeline (My Journey)
setupSteps: Provide a simple timeline (childhood, teen, adult, proud moment).
Write responses as resident dictates if needed.
Save for care conference or family sharing.
checklistItems: Store safely in resident file folder
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside interview format; staff writes answers.
dementiaAdaptation: Focus on feelings and broad memories; avoid correcting details.
lowVisionAdaptation: Staff writes; resident responds verbally.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Complete only 2 sections in 10 minutes.

title: Men’s / Ladies Social Club (Topic Circle)
setupSteps: Choose 1–2 topics (sports, hobbies, family, music, “then vs now”).
Close with next meeting topic vote.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside “club visit” with topic chat.
dementiaAdaptation: Simple topics, shorter meeting, more listening than debating.
lowVisionAdaptation: Spoken circle format.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10-minute bedside topic talk.

title: Men’s Club (Sports Talk & Highlights)
setupSteps: Pick 2–3 sports topics or local team updates.
Queue short highlight clips if using video.
checklistItems: Include quieter residents with direct prompts
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring a short highlights clip on tablet or do verbal recap and ask favorite team/player questions.
dementiaAdaptation: Use familiar teams/players, simple questions, allow storytelling without correcting details.
lowVisionAdaptation: Focus on audio discussion, describe highlights aloud, avoid relying on visuals.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “Top 3 sports memories” and record preferences for future programming.

title: Morning Coffee & Chat
setupSteps: Use 5–8 conversation prompts (favorites, memories, “this or that”).
Keep it relaxed; invite but don’t pressure.
Close with a “today’s good thing” round.
bedBoundAdaptation: Deliver beverage (if allowed) and do a 5-minute chat check-in.
dementiaAdaptation: Use simple prompts and yes/no questions, repeat names, keep group small.
lowVisionAdaptation: Conversation-based; introduce speakers by name.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5 prompts bedside, 10 minutes.

title: Morning Newsletter Reading Circle
setupSteps: Select 5–8 short highlights (facility news, birthdays, positive stories).
bedBoundAdaptation: Read 2–3 highlights bedside and ask one preference question.
dementiaAdaptation: Keep it short, repeat key points, avoid complex details.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read aloud; no written requirement.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute bedside “headlines + chat.”

title: Movie Night
setupSteps: Offer 2–3 movie choices and let residents vote.
Test sound, captions, and screen visibility before start time.
Arrange seating for mobility devices and safe pathways.
Hand out snacks and begin with a brief intro.
Pause midway for restroom break if needed.
checklistItems: Set safe seating layout and lighting
bedBoundAdaptation: Provide in-room viewing option (portable device/TV channel), deliver snack, short check-in during movie.
dementiaAdaptation: Choose familiar classics, shorter runtimes, keep lights dim but not dark, sit near residents who may need reassurance.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use larger screen seating, boost audio clarity, enable captions if helpful, provide a brief verbal recap at key moments.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 20–30 minute “movie short” bedside (classic clips, comedy shorts); quick discussion after (“Favorite part?”).

title: Movie Night (Popcorn & Picks)
setupSteps: Pick movie and confirm licensing/policy as needed.
checklistItems: Announce movie choice and start time
bedBoundAdaptation: Offer in-room viewing with a short movie or TV episode; bring a snack option if allowed.
dementiaAdaptation: Use familiar classics, shorter runtimes, keep lights dim but safe, minimize loud action scenes.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use audio-forward films, increase volume, reduce background noise, offer verbal scene cues if appropriate.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do a 10–15 minute “favorite scenes” watch with reminiscence conversation.

title: Music & Memories (Listening Social)
setupSteps: Play 30–60 sec clips and prompt memories.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring speaker to room for a short “3-song set” and ask one memory question per song.
dementiaAdaptation: Use familiar choruses, keep volume steady, repeat favorites, avoid overstimulating music.
lowVisionAdaptation: Mostly audio-based; announce song titles and artists aloud.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10-minute “jukebox” bedside with 3 songs + 3 questions.

title: Name That Tune
setupSteps: Ask for title/artist or “hum the next line.”
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside version with 5 clips + simple recognition questions (“Do you know this one?”).
dementiaAdaptation: Use extremely familiar songs, accept “I know it!” as success, repeat favorites.
lowVisionAdaptation: Audio-first; announce choices verbally if multiple choice.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-clip bedside set tailored to resident’s era.

title: Name That Tune (Decade Edition)
setupSteps: Explain guessing rules (title/artist or sing along).
checklistItems: Keep score or play just for fun
bedBoundAdaptation: Play 5–8 clips in-room and prompt memories (weddings, dances, concerts).
dementiaAdaptation: Use familiar songs, allow singing as the “answer,” keep it fun and low-pressure.
lowVisionAdaptation: Audio-forward activity works well; keep background noise low and speak clearly.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “3-song memory”: play 3 favorites and ask 1 gentle question per song.

title: No-Bake Snack Demo (Trail Mix Bar)
setupSteps: Confirm dietary restrictions and facility policy.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring a small tray with 2–3 options bedside; resident chooses additions and you assemble.
dementiaAdaptation: Limit choices, use visual bowls, simple prompts (“pick one crunchy, one sweet”).
lowVisionAdaptation: Describe ingredient options; use tactile bowls; provide strong lighting and contrast bowls.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “taste test”: 3 small samples and pick a favorite with simple preference questions.

title: Outdoor Fresh Air Social (Courtyard Time)
setupSteps: Choose safe outdoor location and check comfort needs.
Encourage simple conversation or music listening.
bedBoundAdaptation: If outdoors isn’t possible, do “window time” with sunlight and conversation.
dementiaAdaptation: Keep group small, use simple prompts, avoid overstimulating environments.
lowVisionAdaptation: Describe surroundings verbally (birds, sky, breeze), keep paths clear.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10-minute fresh air check-in with 3 prompts.

title: Pet Therapy Visit (If Available)
setupSteps: Seat residents with clear approach space.
Allow petting/interaction one at a time.
bedBoundAdaptation: Handler visits bedside for brief interaction.
dementiaAdaptation: Keep interaction calm, short, and supervised; watch for fear responses.
lowVisionAdaptation: Tactile experience is ideal; narrate what animal is doing.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute bedside pet visit with calming conversation.

title: Poetry Corner (Read & React)
setupSteps: Ask 1 simple question after each (“What word stood out?”).
Invite residents to share a favorite line.
Close with a calming final read.
bedBoundAdaptation: Read one poem bedside and ask one gentle question.
dementiaAdaptation: Use very short poems, familiar themes, accept any response as valid.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read aloud; avoid requiring reading.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: One poem + one question + one compliment.

title: Price Is Right (SNF Edition)
setupSteps: Choose 6–10 items and set “prices” (realistic or facility-store style).
Explain: closest without going over (or closest wins).
Play rounds: Guess the Price, Higher/Lower, Bonus Round.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring 3-item mini-round to room; resident guesses verbally.
dementiaAdaptation: Use fewer items, two-choice format (higher/lower), celebrate participation.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read items and options aloud; allow touching items when safe.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-question “higher/lower” bedside.

title: Puzzle Table (Community Build)
setupSteps: Choose puzzle with large pieces and clear image.
Set it on a dedicated table area.
checklistItems: Invite residents to add pieces anytime
Store puzzle safely when not in use
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring a 24–60 piece large puzzle bedside on a tray; do 5–10 pieces together.
dementiaAdaptation: Use simpler puzzles, larger pieces, do cooperative sorting, provide frequent encouragement.
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast puzzles, large pieces, strong lighting, allow tactile exploration.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “5-piece win”: pick a small section and complete it together quickly.

title: Puzzle Time
setupSteps: Pick puzzle difficulty based on group.
Set up a table station with good lighting.
Sort edge pieces first as a group.
bedBoundAdaptation: Use a lap tray puzzle board; try 12–24 piece large-piece puzzles.
dementiaAdaptation: Very large pieces, simple images, short sessions, focus on matching colors/shapes.
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast puzzle images, large pieces, allow tactile searching.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10-piece matching puzzle bedside.

title: Read Aloud Book Club (Short Stories)
checklistItems: Invite residents to share related memories
bedBoundAdaptation: Read a short passage bedside and ask 1–2 gentle questions.
dementiaAdaptation: Use simple, familiar topics; shorter readings; repeat main idea; allow residents to just listen.
lowVisionAdaptation: Audio-first; ensure clear speaking and reduced background noise.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “story snack”: one page + one question + one memory prompt.

title: Reminiscence: Life Story Lane
supplies: Old photos (facility-safe or printed stock images)
setupSteps: Explain there’s no pressure to share.
checklistItems: Offer gentle redirection if distress arises
bedBoundAdaptation: Use 3 prompts bedside with supportive listening and brief note of key facts/preferences.
dementiaAdaptation: Use sensory prompts (music, textures, simple photos), ask yes/no or either/or questions.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use tactile or audio prompts; describe any photos clearly.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “3 memories”: favorite food, favorite job, favorite song, with short supportive chat.

title: Resident Relay Race
setupSteps: Create 2–3 “lanes” with chairs lined up for seated stations.
Choose relay style: pass-the-baton, beanbag transfer, balloon tap.
Explain safety rules: seated play encouraged, slow pace, staff assists transfers.
Divide residents into teams and assign each person a station/role.
Run 2–3 short rounds with breaks and a big team celebration.
checklistItems: Clear area and remove trip hazards
Place chairs and lock wheelchair brakes
Explain relay rules and safety reminders
Run short rounds with rest breaks
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside “relay” with staff: resident passes a soft item (cloth/ball) to staff who “runs” to next bedside participant; or timed “tap balloon 10 times” challenge.
dementiaAdaptation: Use one simple motion (pass baton), no scoring pressure, repeat instructions often, assign a staff “buddy” per team.
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast lane markers, verbal direction cues, use tactile baton (pool noodle), staff announces whose turn.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: “Beat the Clock” bedside: pass/transfer 10 items from one container to another with encouragement and rest as needed.

title: Resident Talent Showcase
setupSteps: Ask residents to share a talent: singing, jokes, stories, poems.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside “private showcase” with staff and optional hallway applause.
dementiaAdaptation: Encourage simple shares (favorite song line), no pressure.
lowVisionAdaptation: Spoken performance focus.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute bedside “share a story” showcase.

title: Sensory Snack Social (Taste Test)
bedBoundAdaptation: Deliver approved samples bedside with simple rating.
dementiaAdaptation: Keep choices limited; focus on enjoyment.
lowVisionAdaptation: Taste-based activity; verbal prompts.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 3-sample bedside taste test + favorite pick.

title: Sensory Sorting (Fidgets & Textures)
setupSteps: Demonstrate sorting goal (by color, texture, or size).
End with calming breathing or music.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring a small tray of items bedside; short, calming session.
dementiaAdaptation: Use fewer items, simple categories, focus on comfort not accuracy.
lowVisionAdaptation: Great fit: sorting by texture; verbal labels optional.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 5-minute tactile set + calming close.

title: Sensory Spa Hour (Lotion & Music)
setupSteps: Prepare a calm station with towels and lotion.
Play gentle music and keep lighting comfortable.
bedBoundAdaptation: Do bedside hand lotion and calming music for 10 minutes with gentle conversation.
dementiaAdaptation: Use familiar music, simple reassuring narration, avoid strong scents, keep routine predictable.
lowVisionAdaptation: Great fit; focus on tactile comfort and audio environment.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “hand spa + favorite song”: one song while applying lotion and chatting.

title: Simple Crafts: Greeting Cards
setupSteps: Pre-cut shapes and set out supplies by station.
Assist with writing names/messages as needed.
checklistItems: Set out pre-cut shapes and supplies
bedBoundAdaptation: Use lap tray; sticker-based cards with minimal fine-motor demand.
dementiaAdaptation: Provide step-by-step (1 sticker, 1 stamp, 1 signature), keep choices limited.
lowVisionAdaptation: Large stickers, bold markers, high-contrast paper, staff can write message as resident dictates.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Make one card bedside in 10 minutes.

title: Sock Basketball
setupSteps: Place bin and tape throw lines.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside bin toss with 10 sock balls.
dementiaAdaptation: No scoring, just cheering and turn-taking.
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast bin, verbal cues, closer line.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10 tosses bedside, count together.

title: Spiritual Hymn Sing
setupSteps: Pause between hymns for brief reflection.
bedBoundAdaptation: Bedside hymn sing with 2–3 favorites.
dementiaAdaptation: Familiar hymns only; repeat choruses.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read lyrics aloud; audio-first.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 2 hymns bedside + brief prayer/affirmation.

title: Tabletop Bowling
setupSteps: Set pins in triangle on table.
Residents roll ball from seated position.
checklistItems: Set up pins and roll line
bedBoundAdaptation: Overbed table bowling with cups and soft ball.
dementiaAdaptation: No scoring; simple goal: “knock some down.”
lowVisionAdaptation: High-contrast pins/cups; verbal alignment cues.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10 rolls bedside, count pins together.

title: Tabletop Bowling (Seated)
supplies: Plastic bowling set or cups as pins
setupSteps: Set pins on a table at end of lane.
Mark a rolling line with tape.
checklistItems: Assist with ball grip if needed
bedBoundAdaptation: Use a bedside tray lane and 6 pins; resident rolls ball from lap/bed tray edge with assistance.
dementiaAdaptation: Keep scoring optional, focus on knocking pins down, repeat simple cues, offer hand-over-hand help if appropriate.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use bright pins/ball, high contrast lane, verbal guidance on aim and distance.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do 5 rolls and celebrate personal best; simple and quick.

title: Trivia
setupSteps: Pick theme (oldies music, holidays, states, TV classics, sports).
Decide format: team vs. individual vs. “shout-out” style.
Ask questions at a steady pace; repeat once.
Give hints if needed; keep it light and fun.
End with a bonus round or “resident-choice” question.
checklistItems: Set up seating for teams if needed
Celebrate effort, not just correct answers
bedBoundAdaptation: Include bedside participants by walking questions to them or pausing for their answers; use “A/B/C” multiple choice.
dementiaAdaptation: Use reminiscence trivia (music, foods, “finish the phrase”), simplify to multiple choice, accept close answers, minimize time pressure.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read everything aloud; avoid written answer sheets; use verbal multiple choice.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 10-question “speed round” tailored to interests; end with 1 personal memory question.

title: Trivia Time (Theme Day)
setupSteps: Pick a theme (music, TV, sports, decades).
Set up seating so everyone can hear.
Explain how answers work (shout out, raise hand, teams).
checklistItems: Ask questions clearly and repeat if needed
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring 8–10 questions bedside; use yes/no or multiple-choice options to reduce fatigue.
dementiaAdaptation: Use reminiscence-friendly topics (old TV, big band, hometown traditions); offer 2–3 answer choices; praise effort over accuracy.
lowVisionAdaptation: Read questions and answers aloud; avoid printed handouts as primary; keep background noise low.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “Quick 10” trivia with 10 questions and gentle hints; adapt to resident’s interests.

title: Wheel of Fortune
setupSteps: Set up board with blanks and category label.
Explain rules: guess consonants/vowels, solve puzzle, take turns.
Track used letters and points (or keep it “just for fun”).
Rotate turns and keep pace moving.
checklistItems: Celebrate solves and keep tone upbeat
bedBoundAdaptation: Resident can be “final solver” from bedside, guess letters verbally, staff writes on board and repeats progress.
dementiaAdaptation: Use familiar phrases/sayings, fewer blanks, offer 2–3 letter choices, allow group solving as a team to reduce pressure.
lowVisionAdaptation: Huge letters on board, high-contrast marker, verbally describe puzzle progress (“_ _ A _ / _ A _”), repeat category often.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: 3 quick puzzles bedside; resident guesses letters; staff keeps score optional.

title: Wheel of Fortune (Phrase Guess)
supplies: Dry erase board or large poster board
setupSteps: Write category and blank letter spaces on the board.
Set a visible area for guessed letters.
Choose phrases matched to group ability level.
Explain turn-taking and how to guess letters/solve.
checklistItems: Start with easy phrase to build confidence
bedBoundAdaptation: Use a lapboard/clipboard with a printed phrase puzzle; resident guesses letters while you reveal them.
dementiaAdaptation: Use familiar phrases/sayings, fewer blanks, offer multiple-choice letter options, allow cooperative play instead of strict turns.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use large block letters, high contrast, read the puzzle aloud after each letter fill-in, seat resident closer.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “Finish the Phrase” with 3–5 familiar sayings; resident fills missing word(s).

title: Women’s Circle (Tea & Conversation)
checklistItems: Redirect gently if sensitive topic arises
bedBoundAdaptation: Offer a short bedside chat with 2–3 prompts and beverage option if approved.
dementiaAdaptation: Use sensory prompts (favorite scent, favorite color), simple either/or choices, gentle pacing.
lowVisionAdaptation: Verbal prompts only; reduce background noise and speak clearly.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do “tea talk”: one drink + one prompt + one compliment/affirmation.

title: Word Search
setupSteps: Choose theme (seasonal, music, sports, foods, faith-based).
Print in regular + large print versions.
Explain goal: circle/highlight words; offer time limit if desired.
bedBoundAdaptation: Deliver sheet on lap tray; use thicker marker for easier grip; offer verbal scanning (“look along the top row”).
dementiaAdaptation: Use short word lists (5–8 words), bigger letters, allow “find 3 words” as success, provide frequent encouragement and simple prompts.
lowVisionAdaptation: Extra-large print, bold grid lines, high-contrast marker, allow resident to point while staff circles.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: “Find 5” challenge; staff gives 1 hint per word; end with quick review and praise.

title: Word Search Club
supplies: Word search sheets (large print if possible)
setupSteps: Choose puzzles appropriate to ability level.
Explain goal and offer strategy tips.
checklistItems: Offer hints or circle first letter as cue
bedBoundAdaptation: Bring large-print puzzle on clipboard; assist with holding paper steady; allow short sessions.
dementiaAdaptation: Use smaller grids, fewer words, highlight the word list, do “find 5 words” instead of all.
lowVisionAdaptation: Use large-print puzzles, bold highlighters, magnifier; increase lighting and reduce glare.
oneToOneMiniAdaptation: Do a “guided word find”: choose 5 target words and search together with cues.
